newsitem.title: ITALY: Pirelli & C H1 96 net profit falls.
newsitem.headline: Pirelli & C H1 96 net profit falls.

text.p: Pirelli & C, the financial controlling company of Italy's tyre and cables group Pirelli SpA, said its first-half 1996 net consolidated profits fell to 34.2 billion lire from 54.2 billion in the first half of 1995.
A company statement noted that the results in the first half of 1995 were boosted by the 36.9 billion lire which resulted from the sale of its stake in broker Caboto Holding SpA.
However, Pirelli & C said that its net profits for the whole of 1996 would be in line with those of 1995, when the company recorded a net annual profit of 84 billion lire.
The company added that it had sold two finance companies Milan Mutui SpA and Milano Locazioni Finanziarie SpA to Deutsche Bank SpA in a deal worth over 50 billion lire.
